items.title: "Unable to get page count.\n%s" % err.decode("utf8", "ignore") pdf2image.exceptions.PDFPageCountError: Unable to get page count.
items.body:
Attempting to convert pdf to images fails and this is the Traceback:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\Users\User\Desktop\GIS\PDF to Image\venv\lib\site-packages\pdf2image\pdf2image.py", line 436, in pdfinfo_from_path
    raise ValueError
ValueError

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:/Users/User/Desktop/GIS/PDF to Image/pdf2image_script.py", line 9, in <module>        
    images = convert_from_path(["C:\\Users\\User\\Desktop\\GIS\\PDF to Image\\As-Builts 1\\4A 1st Flr B&W.pdf"], 500)
  File "c:\Users\User\Desktop\GIS\PDF to Image\venv\lib\site-packages\pdf2image\pdf2image.py", line 94, in convert_from_path
    page_count = pdfinfo_from_path(pdf_path, userpw, poppler_path=poppler_path)["Pages"]        
  File "c:\Users\User\Desktop\GIS\PDF to Image\venv\lib\site-packages\pdf2image\pdf2image.py", line 446, in pdfinfo_from_path
    "Unable to get page count.\n%s" % err.decode("utf8", "ignore")
pdf2image.exceptions.PDFPageCountError: Unable to get page count.
```

===============================================

This was the python script I ran on VS Code on a Windows 10 machine:

```
from pdf2image import convert_from_path, convert_from_bytes

from pdf2image.exceptions import (
    PDFInfoNotInstalledError,
    PDFPageCountError,
    PDFSyntaxError
)

images = convert_from_path(["C:\\Users\\User\\Desktop\\GIS\\PDF to Image\\As-Builts 1\\4A 1st Flr B&W.pdf"], 500)

for i, image in enumerate(images):
    fname = "image" + str(i) + ".png"
    image.save(fname, "PNG")
```

I am using Python 3.7.4 (64 bit) and have also installed Poppler via Chocolatey after it seemed to lack required dlls when I installed from anaconda. 

Poppler seems to have a lot of issues on Windows, so I began reading up on [another approach](https://towardsdatascience.com/poppler-on-windows-179af0e50150) that seems promising 

Thanks in advance for your help!

items.title: Layered PDF converts to blank images
items.body:
I looked though the issues here and was unable to find a similar issue, but if this has been solved previously I apologized. Similarly I was unsure if this was a bug so I did not want to report it as such.

pdf2image will convert the PDF correctly if it is exported by "printing to a PDF" essentially "flattening" the PDF. If not printed to a PDF first, the first page converts correctly, but the second two become white pages. Thus we believe that this is layer issue. Maybe there is a way to flatten the layers first, or we are missing an option in pdf2image?

This is the PDF we are having issues with:
[oneword.pdf](https://github.com/Belval/pdf2image/files/4707847/oneword.pdf)

Thank you!

items.title: dpi and size do not work together
items.body:
If you try the following:
`convert_from_path('path_to_pdf', dpi=600, size=400)`
the function returns instantly,  the dpi parameter is ignored and the image quality is bad.

If you try without the size:
`convert_from_path('path_to_pdf', dpi=600)`
the processing takes a lot more time and the end quality of the image is great.

Maybe there should be a warning that these two parameters do not work together.

items.title: Install more recent version of Poppler in Travis
items.body:
Travis ships with Ubuntu 16.04, for which the default poppler version does not support new features like `jpegopt`. While this is not critical, it hinders our ability to include and test these new features.

Simply updating the `.travis.yml` to include a step to install poppler would probably be enough.

items.title: Pathlib Path object support
items.body:
[Pathlib](https://docs.python.org/3/library/pathlib.html) is a standard Python library which offers more powerful and flexible support for paths than [os](https://docs.python.org/3/library/os.html) library.

While you still can use Path objects with pdf2image by casting them as Strings before passing them as arguments, I think it would be better if pdf2image supported this natively.

Worse even, if it attempts to parse a Path as its first positional argument instead of a String, it throws a PDFInfoNotInstalledError exception. I have spent an embarrassing amount of time figuring out how I botched that process. It turns out I didn't, but I did attempt to use Path objects when Strings were expected, and that broke everything.

items.title: Temporary files are not closed properly
items.body:
The temporary files are deleted, but not properly closed. This leads to a too many files open error, when processing large amounts of pdf files.

**To Reproduce**
Example Script:
```
from pathlib import Path
import tempfile
import pdf2image


pdf = Path('./test.pdf').read_bytes()

for i in range(5000):
    with tempfile.TemporaryFile() as tmp_file:
        page_images = pdf2image.convert_from_bytes(pdf, output_file=tmp_file)
        [img.close() for img in page_images]

```

See the leaked files during execution:
`ls -l /proc/{{YOUR PID}}/fd`

**Expected behavior**
The files should get closed properly.

**System:**
 - OS: Ubuntu 18.04
 - Environment: virtualenv with python 3.6.7
 

**Possible fix:**
```
def convert_from_bytes(...):
    fh, temp_filename = tempfile.mkstemp()
    try:
        with open(temp_filename, 'wb') as f:
            f.write(pdf_file)
            f.flush()
            return convert_from_path(...)
    finally:
        os.close(fh)
        os.remove(temp_filename)
```

items.title: RFC: Switching to pdftocairo as a backend instead of pdftoppm
items.body:
It seems that there are two "competing" pdf conversion tools in the poppler projects. The first one being pdftoppm and the second pdftocairo.

Recently I cam across pdftocairo and I realized that it has more features while using the exact same parameters so the switch would be mostly painless. Furthermore, it is distributed as part of poppler-utils just like pdftoppm so most, if not all pdf2image users would already have it on their system.

Does anyone use pdf2image in a setup that would not allow for this change? I would like to know so I could put it in a "new" 2.0 version to avoid backward incompatible change.

For instance: 
If the pages are in portrait orientation till page 6 and the code encounters landscape orientation from page 7 onward, then the pages from 7 to 8 will be blank.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Take a pdf while have combination of pages in two different orientation, say 1-6 in portrait and 7-10 in landscape
2. Run the program with fmt parameter set as  "jpg" and output_folder as "image"
3. You will see that pages 7 and 8 will be blank.

**Expected behavior**
Images to have content similar to pdf

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Windows
 - Python 3.5.5

items.title: __load_from_output_folder fails on MacOS because of .DS_Store file
items.body:
On MacOS, whenever we use 

- `convert_from_path`
- `convert_from_bytes`

functions, if we pass an `output_folder` they end up calling `__load_from_output_folder` function. 

If we use an existing folder, already visited with the Finder app, the function fails saying that `.DS_Store` is not a valid image.

The problem is that this file is created automatically by MacOS Finder app. My suggestion if that this can be fixed passing a list of files to be ignored. If you agree, I can make the pull request.
